property.description: This property specifies what parts of the element’s content any text decoration affecting the element must skip over. It controls all text decoration lines drawn by the element and also any text decoration lines drawn by its ancestors.

name.tooltip: UA must draw contiguous lines without interruptions, even when they cross over a glyph.
Skip this element (its entire margin box) if it is an atomic inline (such as an image or inline-block).
Skip all spacing, i.e. all typographic character units with the Unicode White_Space property [UAX44], plus any adjacent letter-spacing or word-spacing.

Skip all spacing, i.e. all typographic character units with the Unicode White_Space property [UAX44] and all word separators plus any adjacent letter-spacing or word-spacing, when located at the start of the line.

Skip all spacing, i.e. all typographic character units with the Unicode White_Space property [UAX44] and all word separators plus any adjacent letter-spacing or word-spacing, when located at the end of the line.

The UA should place the start and end of the line inwards slightly (e.g. by half a line thickness) from the content edge of the decorating box so that, e.g. two underlined elements side-by-side do not appear to have a single underline. (This is important in Chinese, where underlining is a form of punctuation.) text-decoration-skip: edges for <u>石井</u><u>艾俐俐</u>
Skip over the box’s margin, border, and padding areas. Note that this only has an effect on decorations imposed by an ancestor; a decorating box never draws over its own box decoration.

property.description: This property controls how overlines and underlines are drawn when they cross over a glyph.

name.tooltip: UA should skip over where glyphs are drawn.
UA must draw contiguous lines without interruptions, even when they cross over a glyph.

property.description: This property, which is also a sub-property of the shorthand, sets the stroke thickness of underlines, overlines, and line-throughs.

name.tooltip: The UA chooses an appropriate thickness for text decoration lines; see below.

length.tooltip: Specifies the thickness of text decoration lines as a length. The UA must floor the actual value at one device pixel. Authors are strongly encouraged to use em units so that the line thickness scales with the font.

name.tooltip: Skip Word separators or characters belonging to the Unicode separator category (Z*). (But note that emphasis marks are drawn for a space that combines with any combining characters.)

Skip punctuation. Punctuation in this definition includes characters belonging to the Unicode Pc, Pd, Ps, Pe, Pi, or Pf categories. It also includes characters where the Unicode category is Po and the Sentence_Break property [UAX29] of the Unicode database [UAX44] is ATerm, Close, SContinue, or STerm.
Skip symbols. Symbols in this definition includes characters belonging to the Unicode S* category. It also includes the Unicode Po category that are not defined as punctuation above.
Skip characters where the East_Asian_Width property [UAX11] of the Unicode database [UAX44] is not F (Fullwidth) or W (Wide).

property.description: This property, which is not a sub-property of the shorthand, sets the offset of underlines from their initial position.

name.tooltip: The UA chooses an appropriate offset for underlines.

length.tooltip: Specifies the offset of underlines as a length. This replaces any information in the font or derived from glyph shapes / character ranges. Authors are strongly encouraged to use em units so that the offset scales with the font.
